What controllers did the driver of 254 used in this video of the Cheezy Champs?

I am just curious, thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2021-12-05T00:04:15.697Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":85,"reads":443,"readers_count":442,"score":528.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":397836,"topic_slug":"what-did-254-use-at-the-cheezy-champs-as-their-drive-controllers","display_username":"Justus","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ciEDDmsgSXs","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"254 The Cheesy Poofs Behind the Glass 2021 Chezy Champs - YouTube","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49388,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Microsoft"},"post_url":"/t/what-did-254-use-at-the-cheezy-champs-as-their-drive-controllers/397836/1","custom_user_title":"Microsoft","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":2979931,"name":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","username":"Nate_Laverdure","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nate_laverdure/{size}/134005_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-05T00:12:41.406Z","cooked":"

Looks to me like they are still doing this:

Team 254 Presents: Lockdown Technical Binder 2018 Technical Discussion
It is an off the shelf hall effect joystick (https://www.apem.com/int/hf-series-42.html) with a custom 3d printed handle. We really liked the feel of the bottom of a CH flight stick, but hated the analog circuitry and associated trim wheels for potentiometers. This is a nice compromise. I was fairly certain we had put the most effort into joysticks in FRC until I saw 971’s controller for this year…

Searching CD for “Apem” reveals additional good commentary.
